battleship

Class Sea

extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    : Eddy El Khatib

      void display(boolean defender)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Sea

        public Sea(int nr,
   int nc)

    • Method Detail

      • shoot

        public Answer shoot(Position p)
             throws java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
        returns the appropriate answer concerning the consequences of the shooting action on a position
        Returns:
        an Answer : - MISSED : opponent targets an empty position or a ship cell already hit - HIT : opponent targets a ship cell, which wasn't hit before - SUNK : opponent targets a ship cell, leads the ship to sink
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

      • display

        public void display(boolean defender)
        displays the board line by line and cell by cell, the display changes for the defender or the opponent, defined by the defender argument
        Parameters:
        defender - true if display is for defender, false if is for opponent

      • placeShip

        public void placeShip(Ship shipToPlace,
             Position position,
             Direction direction)
               throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        place the ship b from position p in the direction d. The number of cells is determined by the ship length.
        Parameters:
        shipToPlace - the ship to be placed
        position - the position of the first cell occupied by the ship
        direction - the direction in which b is placed from p
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the ship b can not be placed on the sea (outside of the board or some cell is not empty)
